snippet: G.E. will sell most of its finance arm, focusing on its core industrial operations as it completes a transformation begun during the financial crisis.
abstract: General Electric announces that it plans to sell off most of its finance arm, starting with sale of $26.5 billion in real estate assets; move is in keeping with how other big players in financial world are shifting focus and amid calls to break up or slim down from investors and analysts, and GE plans to revert to its role as one of biggest and most powerful industrial companies in world.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED and ANDREW ROSS SORKIN

lead_paragraph: G.E. will sell most of its finance arm, focusing on its core industrial operations as it completes a transformation begun during the financial crisis.

headline.main: G.E. to Retreat From Finance in Post-Crisis Reorganization
headline.print_headline: General Electric, in a Reorganization, Will Sell Off Its Financial Division
